TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BamlLocalizabilityResolver extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Resolves localizable settings for classes and properties in binary XAML (BAML).

remarks.format: ## Remarks is used by the in order to resolve localizability settings for classes and properties in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)]. The resolver is called both at the time of resource extraction as well as when localized [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] is updated. At the time of resource extraction (), the resolver: - Provides for classes and properties in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] when the is constructing localizable resources. - Provides formatting preferences for elements in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] so elements are formatted as inline tags. At the time at which localized [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] is updated (), the resolver: - Resolves formatting tags back into classes. - Resolves the name of the assembly that contains class definition. - is subclassed by an internal class that performs the practical aspects of the class functions for . ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.ElementLocalizability GetElementLocalizability (string assembly, string className);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.ElementLocalizability GetElementLocalizability(string assembly, string className) cil managed

Docs.param: The full name of the assembly that contains [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] to be localized.
The full class name of the element that you want to retrieve localizability information for.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a specified type of element can be localized and, if so, whether it can be formatted inline.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the localizability information for the specified assembly and element.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Windows.LocalizabilityAttribute GetPropertyLocalizability (string assembly, string className, string property);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.LocalizabilityAttribute GetPropertyLocalizability(string assembly, string className, string property) cil managed

Docs.param: The full name of the assembly that contains [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] to be localized.
The full class name of the element that you want to retrieve localizability information for.
The name of the property that you want to retrieve localizability information for.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a specified property of a specified type of element can be localized.
Docs.returns: An object that specifies whether and how the property can be localized.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ResolveAssemblyFromClass(string className) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the full name of the assembly that contains the specified class.
Docs.returns: The full name of the assembly that contains the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ResolveFormattingTagToClass(string formattingTag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the full class name of a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] tag that has not been encountered in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)].
Docs.returns: The full class name associated with the tag.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called when a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer> or an equivalent is applying substitutions to localizable resources. If a formatting tag is encountered in the substitutions, this method is called to resolve the formatting tag back to a class name.
